study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if meditation training improves perceived cognitive functioning in older adults compared to active and passive control groups.
results_summary: Meditation training reduced vulnerability to external distractors (measured by ASQ) compared to non-native language training, but no differences were found for internal distractors or global cognitive capacities (measured by CDS). The results suggest meditation may enhance the ability to manage external distractions in daily life.
population_specificity: 134 healthy older adults (mean age not specified) from the Age-Well Randomized Clinical Trial.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of meditation on wellness management, including stress reduction, quality of life, and well-being, among corporate employees in India.
results_summary: The study found that meditation significantly improved quality of life (0.21 increase in mean score) and wellness indices (satisfaction with life: 0.21, well-being: 0.24), while reducing stress (0.02 decrease). Compared to the control group, the intervention group showed greater improvements in these outcomes.
population_specificity: Corporate employees from Star Health- and allied insurance companies in India.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the spatiotemporal brain dynamics of expert meditators during meditation and rest, and compare them to controls during rest, using model-free and model-based approaches.
results_summary: The study revealed distinct whole-brain dynamics during meditation compared to rest, identified perturbable brain areas, and demonstrated how transitions between states can be induced with localized artificial perturbations. It suggests meditation may have mechanistic implications for health and therapy in brain disorders.
population_specificity: Expert meditators and controls (non-meditators).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness of loving-kindness meditation (LKM) on reducing job-related burnout in NICU nurses.
results_summary: The study found that LKM significantly reduced burnout scores in the intervention group (P = .003), while no significant difference was observed in the control group (P = .018). These results support the benefit of LKM for reducing burnout in NICU nurses.
population_specificity: NICU nurses from two referral children's hospitals in Tehran (n = 66).
effective_dosage: 20-minute audio files of LKM, 3 times a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of ward noise management combined with meditation training in improving fatigue, sleep quality, and life quality in stroke rehabilitation patients.
results_summary: The study found that combining ward noise management with meditation training significantly improved SF-36 scores (except somatic pain), reduced fatigue, and enhanced sleep quality compared to control and meditation-only groups.
population_specificity: 150 stroke patients hospitalized in a rehabilitation center.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify moderators of intervention effects, comparing mindful awareness practices (MAPs) and survivorship education (SE) on depressive symptoms in younger breast cancer survivors.
results_summary: The study found that MAPs benefited younger breast cancer survivors regardless of pretreatment characteristics, while SE was most effective for those with higher psychological distress and lower preparedness for survivorship. MAPs showed consistent efficacy across different baseline conditions.
population_specificity: Women diagnosed with stage 0 to III breast cancer at or before age 50 who completed cancer treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining anodal tDCS of the left M1 with mindfulness meditation (MM) provided additional benefits over MM alone in fibromyalgia patients.
results_summary: The study found post-treatment improvements in clinical outcomes, including mindfulness levels, but no significant difference between active tDCS and sham conditions, suggesting no additive effect of tDCS.
population_specificity: Fibromyalgia patients trained in mindfulness.
effective_dosage: Ten daily sessions of mindfulness meditation paired with tDCS (active or sham).
study_duration: Ten days, with a one-month follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether loving kindness meditation (LKM) could reduce explicit and implicit anti-fat bias and increase empathy toward individuals with higher weight.
results_summary: The LKM intervention increased empathic care but did not reduce anti-fat bias compared to control. Both LKM and empathy interventions were associated with greater stigmatizing behavior compared to control.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract (likely general adult population).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the proportion of people with cardiovascular disease (CVD) who practice meditation and identify factors influencing its usage.
results_summary: Approximately 16% of CVD respondents practiced meditation, with spiritual meditation being the most common (82.5%). Predictors of meditation use included being female, advised to increase physical activity, and email use, while affordability of medication or mental health care reduced usage odds.
population_specificity: Adults with cardiovascular disease in the United States (4,197 respondents from the 2017 National Health Interview Survey).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility and usability of a 4-week neuromeditation training in adult forensic outpatients with impulse control problems.
results_summary: Eight patients completed the neuromeditation training, which was rated sufficiently usable and feasible by both patients and therapists, despite some emerging obstacles. The study suggests improvements for future implementation and trials to evaluate effectiveness.
population_specificity: Adult forensic outpatients with impulse control problems.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the efficacy of mindfulness meditation (MM) in treating internet gaming disorder (IGD) and identify the neural mechanisms underlying its effects.
results_summary: MM significantly reduced IGD severity and gaming cravings compared to progressive muscle relaxation (PMR), with associated decreases in brain activation in key regions and increased functional connectivity mediating reduced cravings.
population_specificity: Adults (aged ≥18 years) meeting at least 6 of the 9 DSM-5-TR proposed criteria for IGD.
effective_dosage: 8-session meditation program (2 sessions per week for 4 weeks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the efficacy of Relaxation Response Meditation Training (RRMT) on elderly individuals with varying levels of vividness of visual imagery, focusing on sleep quality, fatigue, well-being, and relaxation.
results_summary: The study found that RRMT significantly improved sleep quality, reduced fatigue, and enhanced general well-being, particularly in high-visualizers. Low-visualizers showed slower and less pronounced benefits, suggesting they may require alternative approaches.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals over 60 years with nonorganic sleep disorders.
effective_dosage: Twice a week for 4 weeks (total of 8 sessions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the feasibility and preliminary effectiveness of an online, concussion-focused meditation intervention for young adults with a history of concussion.
results_summary: The study found high feasibility and adherence to the meditation intervention, with significant reductions in concussion symptom severity and the number of symptoms reported as worse than pre-injury. A majority of participants reported symptom improvement post-intervention.
population_specificity: Young adults aged 18-30 with a concussion history within the past 5 years.
effective_dosage: 10-20 minutes per day of guided meditations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of mindfulness training on attention lapses and their neural correlates during meditation, using EEG to identify associated brainwave patterns.
results_summary: Mindfulness training did not reduce attention lapses or their associated theta oscillations but was linked to slowing of frontal alpha oscillations, a pattern seen in experienced meditators and associated with decreased arousal.
population_specificity: 41 participants (21 in treatment, 20 controls)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore breast cancer survivors' experiences and effects of a yoga and meditation intervention, supplementing previously reported RCT outcomes.
results_summary: Participants reported positive effects of the yoga and meditation intervention at emotional, physical, behavioral, and spiritual levels, with all interviewees either continuing yoga or expressing a desire to do so. The study suggested yoga as a promising intervention for breast cancer survivors.
population_specificity: Female breast cancer survivors undergoing antihormonal therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and suitability of meditation as an adjunctive treatment for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder in children.
results_summary: The study found that meditation is safe, partially effective, cost-effective, and a sensible adjunctive treatment strategy for ADHD in children, though the literature shows heterogeneity in study methods and risk of bias.
population_specificity: Children with attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of religious/spiritual (R/S) singing and R/S movement (including dynamic meditation) as alternative mental health interventions.
results_summary: The review found a positive trend for the effectiveness of R/S singing and movement (including dynamic meditation) in addressing mental health concerns, though the included studies were of moderate to poor quality. The limited number and methodological constraints of the studies suggest cautious interpretation of the findings.
population_specificity: Not specified (general mental health concerns, likely diverse populations based on the review's scope).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore a mechanistic understanding of focused attention meditation by formulating it in terms of active inference and predictive processing.
results_summary: The study suggests that voluntary attention to the body in meditation helps settle the mind by reducing habitual and automatic reactions and distracting thoughts. It also discusses a possible relationship between phenomenological notions and precision-weighting via attention allocation.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the relative contribution of live and recorded mindfulness training in reducing perceived stress among employees.
results_summary: The study found that participation in the mindfulness program reduced stress, with live programs supplemented by recorded sessions showing the strongest likelihood of significant stress reduction. Most participants engaged in both live and recorded options, with those using recordings tending to use them 3-4 times.
population_specificity: Employees from 44 companies (N=8341).
effective_dosage: Participants were encouraged to spend 14 minutes (1% of their day) practicing mindfulness meditation daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how genetic factors influence differential responses to various therapies, including meditation, in the context of neural plasticity and recovery.
results_summary: The study found that genetic variation can affect response to meditation and other therapies, potentially influencing recovery outcomes and plasticity, particularly when considered alongside clinical factors like experience and therapy type.
population_specificity: Individuals with neural injury or disorders, focusing on genetic variation's role in therapy response.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the cardiovascular effects of emotional stress and potential therapeutic interventions, including transcendental meditation.
results_summary: The study suggests that acute mental stress can trigger cardiovascular events and that stress management techniques like transcendental meditation warrant further investigation for their potential to prevent plaque rupture.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of cardiovascular events in developed world populations)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of meditation versus stretching in reducing muscle cramp severity and improving quality of life in patients with cirrhosis and frequent muscle cramps.
results_summary: Meditation significantly reduced cramp severity and improved sleep quality and global impression of change, though patients preferred stretching. HRQOL improved slightly with meditation but not stretching.
population_specificity: Patients with a history of >4 muscle cramps in the prior month, 48% with cirrhosis, 40% with diabetes, median age 63, mostly women (67%), and 81% college-educated.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate a school-based intervention (FOODWISELab) grounded in Mediterranean diet principles to improve adolescent food literacy in Portugal.
results_summary: The study synthesized experiential strategies (e.g., school gardens, cooking classes) to design a culturally relevant intervention. It proposed a structured model integrating hands-on learning and community involvement to address adolescent food literacy gaps.
population_specificity: Socioeconomically disadvantaged adolescents in Portuguese public secondary schools (urban and rural).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how the Mediterranean Diet and its bioactive compounds influence mitochondrial health in nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
results_summary: The study found that the Mediterranean Diet offers metabolic and hepatoprotective benefits, improving insulin sensitivity and lipid metabolism through antioxidant and anti-inflammatory effects. Emerging evidence suggests its bioactive compounds enhance mitochondrial function, though gaps remain in understanding its holistic impact.
population_specificity: Individuals with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the role of adherence to the Mediterranean Diet (MD) in relation to sexual dysfunction (SD) in patients with Chronic Liver Diseases (CLD), particularly Metabolic dysfunction-Associated Steatotic Liver Disease (MASLD).
results_summary: The study found that while adherence to the Mediterranean Diet was higher in nonMASLD patients compared to MASLD patients, it was not an independent protective factor against sexual dysfunction. Quality of Life (QoL) appeared to play a more significant role in SD outcomes.
population_specificity: 207 CLD patients (84 females, 123 males), median age 57 years, including 96 MASLD and 111 nonMASLD patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine Mediterranean diet adherence among family members from four Mediterranean countries (Türkiye, Spain, Italy, and Lebanon) and identify obstacles and drivers of adherence.
results_summary: The study found that 22% of adults and 30% of children/adolescents strongly adhered to the Mediterranean diet, with Lebanon showing significantly stronger adherence. Price, availability, and accessibility were key obstacles, while health perceptions and diet quality were drivers.
population_specificity: Adults (n = 812) and their children (n = 500) from Türkiye, Spain, Italy, and Lebanon.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the acceptability and experiences of an ad libitum Mediterranean Diet in women with PCOS and provide recommendations for implementation.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in Mediterranean Diet adherence, knowledge, cooking confidence, and time management over 12 weeks. Key facilitators included health benefits and educational resources, while barriers involved organization and food availability.
population_specificity: Women aged 18-45 years diagnosed with PCOS and a BMI ≥ 25 kg/m2 (n = 12).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between ADHD symptoms and dietary alignment with the Mediterranean Diet (MD) in young adults.
results_summary: Greater adherence to the MD was significantly associated with lower ADHD symptom scores, including attention deficit and hyperactivity/impulsivity, with strong negative correlations observed. The study suggests that the MD may help reduce ADHD risk, though causal inference is limited by the cross-sectional design.
population_specificity: 440 university students aged 18 to 24 years in Türkiye.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a weight-loss lifestyle intervention involving an energy-reduced Mediterranean diet and increased physical activity on bone mineral density (BMD), bone mineral content (BMC), and low BMD prevalence in older adults with metabolic syndrome and overweight or obesity.
results_summary: The intervention group showed a protective association against BMD decline in older women after 3 years, with significant improvements in lumbar spine BMD, but no overall effect on total BMC or low BMD prevalence. No significant benefits were observed in men.
population_specificity: Older adults (aged 55-75 years) with metabolic syndrome and overweight or obesity, recruited from Spain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between adherence to the Mediterranean diet and cancer-related fatigue, particularly in cancer patients.
results_summary: The study found a significant inverse relationship between Mediterranean diet adherence (measured by AMED scores) and fatigue, with a stronger effect in cancer patients. Alcohol intake was notably negatively associated with fatigue in cancer patients, and subgroup analyses indicated that factors like diabetes and education level influenced this relationship.
population_specificity: Adults aged 20+ from NHANES 2017-2020.03, including 707 cancer patients.
effective_dosage: Not specified (adherence measured via AMED scores based on 24-h dietary recall).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of combining alpha-lipoic acid (ALA) and Silybum marianum (SM) supplementation with a Mediterranean diet on metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD).
results_summary: The study observed improvements in visceral fat and controlled attenuation parameters (CAP), but key metabolic markers like transaminases and lipid profiles showed no significant changes, raising concerns about the intervention's comprehensive metabolic impact.
population_specificity: Mexican cohort with MASLD

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of Mediterranean diet adherence on the risk and progression of diabetic microvascular complications (retinopathy, nephropathy, and neuropathy).
results_summary: The study found that adherence to the Mediterranean diet was associated with a reduced risk of diabetic retinopathy and nephropathy, but results for neuropathy were inconclusive due to study heterogeneity.
population_specificity: Individuals with diabetes (sample sizes ranged from 138 to 71,392 participants).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between Mediterranean Diet adherence at ages 40, 50, and 60 and subclinical carotid atherosclerosis at age 60.
results_summary: Higher Mediterranean Diet adherence was associated with lower carotid plaque presence at age 60, with stronger associations in women for plaque and in men for carotid artery thickness. No significant associations were found with the Healthy Diet Score.
population_specificity: Swedish participants aged 60 with retrospective dietary data from ages 40, 50, and 60 (n=1034).
study_duration: Dietary patterns assessed retrospectively over 20 years (ages 40-60).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to validate whether the Mediterranean Diet (MetD) modulates the association between the TCF7L2 gene variant and cardiovascular disease risk, focusing on triglyceride-rich lipoprotein profiles.
results_summary: The MetD significantly reduced triglyceride-rich lipoprotein concentrations compared to a low-fat diet, particularly benefiting TT genotype carriers of the TCF7L2 rs7903146 variant, potentially lowering their CVD risk. The diet order (LF-MetD vs. MetD-LF) also influenced triglyceride-rich lipoprotein levels.
population_specificity: 35 participants with BMI 27-34 kg/m², stratified by TCF7L2 rs7903146 genotype (21 CC, 14 TT carriers).
study_duration: 1 week per diet, with a 10-day washout between interventions

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate how adherence to a Mediterranean dietary pattern can complement traditional treatments for psoriasis, acne, and hidradenitis suppurativa by reducing inflammation and improving metabolic factors.
results_summary: The study found that the Mediterranean diet, rich in antioxidant and anti-inflammatory foods, reduces clinical severity of these skin conditions, supports weight control, and improves metabolic and cardiovascular risk factors. Dietary education on this diet is highlighted as a key non-pharmacological treatment option.
population_specificity: Patients with psoriasis, acne, and hidradenitis suppurativa.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify factors influencing adherence to the Mediterranean Diet among patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus in Mediterranean countries.
results_summary: Compliance with the Mediterranean Diet was moderate, with key determinants being age, physical activity, BMI, marital status, and educational level. Limited data were available on psychological and economic factors affecting adherence.
population_specificity: Adults aged 18+ with type 2 diabetes mellitus residing in Mediterranean countries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the association between adherence to the Mediterranean diet and health-related quality of life, particularly in aging populations and those with chronic conditions.
results_summary: Most studies showed a significant association between Mediterranean diet adherence and improved health-related quality of life, especially in physical domains, benefiting both the general population and individuals with chronic inflammatory conditions.
population_specificity: General population and various types of patients, particularly those with chronic conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and clinical outcomes of the Mediterranean Diet (MD) for managing inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and provide evidence-based guidance for its integration into IBD management.
results_summary: The study found that the MD enhances gut microbiota diversity, reduces intestinal inflammation, improves disease activity, and enhances quality of life in IBD patients, with strong adherence rates and minimal adverse effects.
population_specificity: Patients with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how the Mediterranean Diet interacts with the TCF7L2 rs7903146 genotype to influence blood metabolites, particularly lipid factors.
results_summary: The study found that the Mediterranean Diet had a stronger influence on regulating lipid factors in individuals with the CC genotype, showing significant interactions for delta-saturated and delta-monounsaturated fatty acids, unlike the low-fat diet.
population_specificity: 35 individuals (43% female), aged 18-70, with BMI 26.4-33.9 kg/m², and specific TCF7L2 rs7903146 genotypes (CC or TT).
study_duration: 1 week per diet (Mediterranean and low-fat), with ~10 days' washout between diets.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of a high-intensity Mediterranean Diet intervention on skin involvement, metabolic parameters, inflammatory cytokines, and quality of life in patients with mild-to-moderate psoriasis.
results_summary: The study protocol outlines the design but does not yet report results; enrollment concluded in October 2024, with data collection set to finish by February 2025.
population_specificity: Patients with mild-to-moderate psoriasis (n=38).
effective_dosage: 500 mL of extra virgin olive oil per week, along with dietary education sessions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the evidence linking adherence to the Mediterranean diet with sarcopenia prevention and muscle health in older adults.
results_summary: Observational studies suggest the Mediterranean diet has positive effects on muscle function, but intervention studies are lacking. The diet is associated with multiple health benefits, though its direct role in sarcopenia prevention requires further investigation.
population_specificity: Older adults at risk of sarcopenia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of the Mediterranean Diet on child health and establish preventive strategies for chronic diseases in an underserved community.
results_summary: The study protocol outlines a plan to assess growth, microbiome composition, and adherence to the Mediterranean Diet over six years, but no results are reported yet. The trial will use Italy's Family Pediatrician network to implement dietary interventions in a real-world setting.
population_specificity: Children in Scampia, a socioeconomically disadvantaged district in Naples, Italy, starting at weaning.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine initial adherence to the Mediterranean Diet in poorly controlled type 2 diabetes patients and analyze the effects of a nutritional educational intervention on glycemic control and diet adherence.
results_summary: The study found that poor glycemic control and high BMI were linked to low Mediterranean Diet adherence. Post-intervention, adherence improved, with increased consumption of healthy foods (e.g., olive oil, nuts) and decreased intake of processed foods, leading to better metabolic control.
population_specificity: 93 patients with poorly controlled type 2 diabetes (A1c ≥ 7%) from health centers in Albacete and Cuenca.

study_goal: To determine changes in body composition and pro-inflammatory cytokines in patients with metabolic syndrome after a Mediterranean-type diet and/or isokinetic exercise.
results_summary: The study found that Mediterranean Diet (MedDiet) and isokinetic exercise (IE) selectively impacted pro-inflammatory mediators, with MedDiet + IE showing a reduction in resistin and IL-10. All intervention groups showed increased resistance values in body composition compared to baseline, though these were lower than the control group.
population_specificity: 42 patients with metabolic syndrome aged 18-65 years, primarily with obesity, insulin resistance, and dyslipidemia.
effective_dosage: MedDiet was estimated from a 24-hour recall record (specific amounts not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a multidisciplinary lifestyle intervention (SYNCHRONIZE +) in improving adherence to the Mediterranean diet, nutrition quality, and dietary intake patterns in individuals with fibromyalgia and chronic fatigue syndrome.
results_summary: The intervention improved adherence to the Mediterranean diet, increased intake of legumes, fruits, vegetables, nuts, and blue fish, and reduced consumption of sweets, pastries, butter, cream, red and processed meat. It also improved muscle mass index and reduced night eating, with effects maintained in the medium to long term.
population_specificity: Persons with fibromyalgia and chronic fatigue syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the relationship between adherence to the Mediterranean diet and the risk of stroke through a comprehensive meta-analysis.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found a significant reduction in stroke risk among individuals adhering to the Mediterranean diet, with a pooled hazard ratio of 0.88 (95% CI: 0.84-0.91). Despite some heterogeneity and potential publication bias, the evidence supports the diet's protective effect against stroke.
population_specificity: Not specified (meta-analysis of 30 studies, including cohort and case-control designs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the serum total antioxidant level, nutritional status, and Mediterranean diet adherence in adult women with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) compared to healthy controls.
results_summary: The study found that RA patients had lower serum total antioxidant status and dietary antioxidant intake compared to controls. Higher fibre intake was associated with a significantly lower risk for RA after adjusting for confounding factors.
population_specificity: Adult women with rheumatoid arthritis (35 patients) and healthy controls (35 individuals).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine factors determining adherence to the Mediterranean diet among Moroccan school-age adolescents.
results_summary: The study found very low adherence to the Mediterranean diet, with 53% showing poor adherence and only 7.7% reporting optimal adherence. Poor adherence was correlated with female gender, low paternal education, fewer meals, advanced age, and inadequate sleep, while better adherence was linked to more meals and higher paternal socio-professional class.
population_specificity: Moroccan school-age adolescents (14-18 years, 386 students, 148 boys and 238 girls).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the mechanism by which the Mediterranean Diet (MedDiet) exerts its beneficial effects on aging, specifically its potential to slow down 'inflamm-aging.'
results_summary: The study identified 14 papers representing 12 unique RCTs, suggesting that the MedDiet may help mitigate chronic low-grade inflammation associated with aging. The findings led to 10 recommendations for future clinical trials on MedDiet and inflamm-aging.
population_specificity: General population (not further specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between maternal genetic variants related to gestational diabetes mellitus and low birth weight, within the context of a nutritional intervention involving Mediterranean diet.
results_summary: The study identified 33 genetic variants associated with low birth weight, which clustered into subsets linked to biological processes and maternal characteristics, suggesting potential for early risk prevention. The Mediterranean diet intervention was part of the multifactorial approach but specific efficacy results were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: 1,642 pregnant women with anthropometric and metabolic data.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to consolidate existing research on the benefits of the Mediterranean diet for improving health outcomes in overweight or obese breast cancer survivors.
results_summary: The Mediterranean diet effectively reduced BMI, waist circumference, and fat mass in overweight or obese breast cancer survivors, but showed no significant impact on cholesterol levels. Quality of life assessments were inconsistent across studies.
population_specificity: Overweight or obese breast cancer survivors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test the feasibility, acceptability, and cognitive effects of a personalized theory-based intervention to improve Mediterranean diet adherence, alone or combined with physical activity, in older adults at risk of dementia.
results_summary: The intervention improved Mediterranean diet adherence and showed cognitive benefits, including enhanced general cognition and memory, but did not significantly change physical activity levels. The effects were maintained for up to 12 months.
population_specificity: Older adults (57-76 years, 74% female) at risk of dementia, defined using a cardiovascular risk score.
effective_dosage: Not specified (intervention included personalized targets, web-based support, group sessions, and food provision).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the feasibility and preliminary effects of a gamified home-based cognitive-nutritional intervention (GAHOCON) on Mediterranean diet knowledge, adherence, cognitive function, and physical frailty in older adults with cognitive frailty.
results_summary: The intervention group showed significant improvements in Mediterranean diet adherence, cognitive function, physical frailty, and walking speed, while retaining Mediterranean diet knowledge, unlike the control group. No significant improvements were observed in the control group.
population_specificity: Community-dwelling adults aged 60 years or older with cognitive frailty and poor adherence to the Mediterranean diet.
study_duration: 12 weeks (4 weeks center-based training, 8 weeks home-based training)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the association between neutrophil count and carotid artery thickness (IMT-CC) and assess the impact of long-term Mediterranean or low-fat dietary interventions on these associations.
results_summary: The study found that elevated neutrophil counts were associated with increased carotid artery thickness, but patients following a Mediterranean diet showed significant reductions in neutrophil levels and regression in IMT-CC after 5 and 7 years. The Mediterranean diet was suggested as a potential strategy to slow atherosclerosis progression by reducing neutrophil levels.
population_specificity: Patients in the CORDIOPREV study, a long-term secondary prevention study involving dietary interventions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the relationship between adherence to the Mediterranean Diet (MD) and insomnia prevalence among Arab men in Jordan.
results_summary: High adherence to the MD was associated with an increased risk of insomnia (OR = 1.642, p = 0.028), contrary to expectations, suggesting an unexpected relationship that warrants further investigation.
population_specificity: Arab men aged 18 and older living in Jordan.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a Mediterranean diet (MedDiet) combined with metformin could reduce the incidence of major noncommunicable diseases in individuals with metabolic syndrome.
results_summary: The study found that the combination of metformin and MedDiet significantly reduced the incidence of type 2 diabetes (92% lower than placebo), but the overall reduction in major noncommunicable diseases was primarily driven by diabetes prevention. The MedDiet alone (with placebo) showed less efficacy compared to metformin-based interventions.
population_specificity: Individuals with metabolic syndrome.
effective_dosage: Not specified for MedDiet (metformin dosage was 1,700 mg/day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the potential health benefits of the Mediterranean diet, particularly its protective effects against osteoarthritis (OA) development and symptom severity.
results_summary: Observational studies linked Mediterranean diet adherence to reduced OA risk and symptom severity, while intervention studies showed improvements in pain, function, and quality of life for OA patients. Potential mechanisms include reduced inflammation, oxidative stress, and cartilage degradation.
population_specificity: Individuals with or at risk of osteoarthritis (OA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to quantify the reduction in cardiovascular disease (CVD), type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM), hypertension, and hypercholesterolemia cases due to long-term adherence to the Mediterranean diet using the Prevented Fraction for the Population (PFP) metric.
results_summary: The study found that approximately 30% of CVD, T2DM, hypertension, and hypercholesterolemia cases were prevented due to high long-term adherence to the Mediterranean diet. Male participants, older individuals, and those with comorbidities showed lower adherence and might benefit more from sustained dietary changes.
population_specificity: Adult participants initially free of CVD from the ATTICA prospective cohort study (2002-2022) in a Mediterranean population.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential therapeutic benefits of a Mediterranean diet for managing cardiometabolic, reproductive, and psychological symptoms in women with PCOS.
results_summary: Observational evidence suggests an inverse relationship between Mediterranean diet adherence and PCOS features, particularly insulin resistance and hyperandrogenemia, likely due to its anti-inflammatory properties. However, current evidence remains insufficient to inform clinical practice, and more well-designed trials are needed.
population_specificity: Reproductive-aged women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the acute and sustained effects of the Mediterranean Diet on endothelial function in patients with high cardiometabolic risk.
results_summary: The study found that the Mediterranean Diet significantly improved endothelial function compared to the Control Diet, both in the short-term (2 hours post-meal) and medium-term (8 weeks), as measured by flow-mediated dilation (FMD). The MD was an independent predictor of positive changes in FMD after adjusting for confounding factors.
population_specificity: Patients with high cardiometabolic risk (n=25).
effective_dosage: Not specified (dietary intervention, not supplement dosage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of a Culinary Medicine program on healthcare professionals' adherence to the Mediterranean diet and their related knowledge and skills.
results_summary: The study found significant improvement in Mediterranean diet adherence among participants, along with enhanced perceptions of dietary advice usefulness, patient-transferable knowledge, cooking techniques, and personal cooking confidence.
population_specificity: 20 healthcare professionals (86% women, 14% men, 86% aged above 40) from Hospital Clinic Barcelona, primarily nurses (71%).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of dietary factors, particularly the Mediterranean diet, on glaucoma pathogenesis, prevention, and treatment.
results_summary: The study suggests that the Mediterranean diet may have potential benefits in glaucoma prevention and treatment, alongside other dietary components like omega-3 fatty acids and vitamins. The review highlights the importance of dietary habits in managing glaucoma but does not provide definitive conclusions.
population_specificity: Not specified (general population or glaucoma patients inferred).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how adherence to the Mediterranean Diet (MDiet) and physical activity (PA) influences subclinical atherosclerotic disease (SAD) progression in the ILERVAS cohort.
results_summary: Higher adherence to the MDiet was associated with a 3% decrease in the number of territories with plaque, suggesting a protective effect against SAD. However, neither the combined lifestyle score nor PA alone showed significant effects on SAD progression.
population_specificity: 3097 participants from the ILERVAS prospective cohort.
effective_dosage: Not specified (adherence assessed via MEDAS score).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of the Mediterranean Diet on athletic performance, strength, body composition, and metabolic markers in both athletes and non-professional athletes.
results_summary: The Mediterranean Diet improved muscle endurance, power, and anaerobic performance in CrossFit athletes, and enhanced strength performance (e.g., vertical jump height, hand grip strength). Effects on body composition were mixed, but the diet showed positive impacts on antioxidant activity and reduced oxidative stress and inflammation.
population_specificity: Professional handball players and non-professional strength athletes (total 116 participants).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of the Mediterranean Diet on gut microbial diversity, intestinal symptoms, and biomarkers in patients with gastrointestinal disorders.
results_summary: The study found that the Mediterranean Diet altered fungal intestinal microbiota, reducing certain fungi and improving gastrointestinal disorders, while bacterial microbiota remained unchanged. Associations between stool consistency, intestinal permeability, and specific bacterial genera were also observed.
population_specificity: 46 patients with gastrointestinal disorders

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the prevalence of sexual dysfunction in IBD patients and assess the role of adherence to the Mediterranean Diet (MD) and quality of life (QoL) in mitigating these dysfunctions.
results_summary: The study found that higher adherence to the Mediterranean Diet was protective against sexual dysfunction in females (OR 0.8), while in males, a higher physical health score (PCS) was associated with lower sexual dysfunction risk. Disease activity was linked to higher sexual dysfunction prevalence in both sexes.
population_specificity: 301 IBD patients (134 females, 167 males; 119 with Crohn's Disease, 182 with ulcerative colitis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of the Mediterranean diet on fecal fatty acid composition and its association with intestinal barrier integrity.
results_summary: The study found that adherence to the Mediterranean diet led to distinct changes in fecal fatty acid composition, including decreased palmitoleic and arachidonic acids and increased linoleic and α-linoleic acids. These changes correlated with improved intestinal barrier integrity markers, such as reduced plasma lipopolysaccharide-binding protein.
population_specificity: Women with hereditary breast and ovarian cancer characterized by impaired intestinal barrier integrity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the association between adherence to the Mediterranean diet (aMED) and different types of urinary incontinence (UI) in women.
results_summary: Higher adherence to the Mediterranean diet was associated with lower odds of urgency UI and mixed UI, particularly in women aged 45-60, those with high NLR, and smokers. No significant association was found between aMED and stress UI.
population_specificity: Women aged ≥18 years diagnosed with stress UI, urgency UI, or mixed UI, extracted from NHANES 2005-2018.
effective_dosage: Not specified (dietary intake assessed via 24-hour recall).
study_duration: Not specified (cross-sectional analysis of NHANES data).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether adherence to the Mediterranean Diet (MD) is associated with circulating markers of redox balance and inflammation in elderly patients hospitalized in internal medicine wards.
results_summary: Low adherence to the MD was linked to impaired redox balance (higher GSSG/GSH ratio, increased oxidative stress markers) and elevated systemic inflammation (higher neutrophil-to-lymphocyte ratio, interleukin-6, and tumor necrosis factor levels) compared to high adherence. A strong association was found between redox imbalance and inflammation, particularly in the low-adherence group.
population_specificity: 306 elderly acute patients hospitalized in internal medicine wards.

study_goal: To evaluate the effectiveness of the Mediterranean diet in improving liver function in children and adolescents with metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD).
results_summary: The Mediterranean diet was associated with moderate improvements in liver function, as shown by reductions in liver enzymes (ALT, AST, and GGT), but changes in body weight, lipid profile, and insulin resistance were small and insignificant.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents with MASLD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess adherence to the Mediterranean diet and the adequacy of micro- and macronutrient intake in patients treated with Pegvaliase for PKU.
results_summary: MedDiet adherence in the sample was comparable to the general population, with good macronutrient adherence but excessive simple sugar consumption. Micronutrient intake was inadequate for zinc, iron, selenium, folate, thiamine, and riboflavin.
population_specificity: Seven patients on chronic therapy with Pegvaliase for phenylketonuria (PKU).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether adherence to the Mediterranean diet could enhance the effectiveness of existing therapeutic treatments for temporomandibular joint disorder (TMD).
results_summary: Participants with medium or high adherence to the Mediterranean diet reported fewer jaw functionality problems before and after the intervention compared to those with low adherence. The study found a statistically significant difference in jaw functionality based on diet adherence.
population_specificity: Patients with temporomandibular joint disorder (TMD).
effective_dosage: Not specified (adherence levels were categorized as low (<18), medium, or high (≥18) based on a Mediterranean diet adherence score).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a VLCFA-restricted Mediterranean diet in reducing plasma VLCFA levels in patients and carriers of adrenoleukodystrophy (X-ALD).
results_summary: Compliant adult patients and carriers showed significant reductions in plasma VLCFA levels (C26:0, C26:0/C22:0 ratio) and triglycerides after one year on the diet. The diet was effective in lowering these biomarkers compared to non-compliant individuals and baseline measurements.
population_specificity: 36 patients and 20 carriers of adrenoleukodystrophy (X-ALD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the current status and research hotspots on the connection between the Mediterranean diet and diabetes mellitus (DM) from 2014 to 2024.
results_summary: Research on the Mediterranean diet and DM showed a steady increase in publications, with Spain leading in output and collaborations. Key mechanisms included antioxidant effects, improved insulin sensitivity, lipid metabolism regulation, and gut microbiota modulation.
population_specificity: Global research focus, no specific population mentioned.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of shifting from a traditional Mediterranean diet to a vegan Mediterranean diet on cardiorespiratory fitness and lipid profile in physically active and healthy men.
results_summary: The shift to a vegan Mediterranean diet reduced total cholesterol (-22.6 mg/dl) and LDL cholesterol (-12.8 mg/dl), with an inverse correlation between dietary fiber intake and LDL-C. The diet improved cardiometabolic health outcomes.
population_specificity: Physically active and healthy men, mean age 24.6 ± 7.0 years (range: 18-37).
effective_dosage: Not specified (isocaloric substitution of animal-based foods with plant-based alternatives).
study_duration: 3 weeks baseline (traditional Mediterranean diet), 4 weeks intervention (vegan Mediterranean diet), with a 7-day washout.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the relationship between adherence to the Mediterranean diet and peripheral artery disease in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.
results_summary: Adherence to the Mediterranean diet was associated with reduced vascular complications in type 2 diabetes, including lower prevalence of peripheral artery disease, diabetic foot ulcers, and intermittent claudication. Nut consumption, white meat preference, and sautéed dish intake were also linked to PAD presence.
population_specificity: 174 patients diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus, including 78 with peripheral artery disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential of the Mediterranean Diet (MeDi) in preventing and ameliorating ocular diseases such as diabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, and glaucoma.
results_summary: The study suggests that adherence to the Mediterranean Diet, rich in vitamins, carotenoids, flavonoids, and omega-3 fatty acids, may help modulate pathophysiological responses and reduce complications like inflammation and neurodegeneration in ocular diseases. Several characteristic compounds of MeDi are proposed as beneficial adjuvants against these conditions.
population_specificity: Individuals with or at risk of ocular diseases (diabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, glaucoma).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a Mediterranean diet-oriented intervention could improve mitochondrial function and systemic inflammatory markers in patients with MASLD.
results_summary: After twelve months of intervention, MASLD patients showed restored mitochondrial respiratory capacity in PBMCs and no differences in systemic inflammatory and bioenergetics parameters compared to controls, coinciding with improved adherence to the Mediterranean diet.
population_specificity: Patients with Metabolic Dysfunction-Associated Steatotic Liver Disease (MASLD) (N = 15) and non-MASLD controls (N = 17).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety and short-term impact of the Mediterranean Proper Optimal Balance (MEDi-POB) diet on kidney function in Korean patients with stage 3-4 chronic kidney disease (CKD).
results_summary: The MEDi-POB diet significantly increased dietary fat, fiber, and niacin intake while reducing sodium and copper intake. It also slightly improved metabolic acidosis management and maintained kidney function without adversely affecting serum or urine potassium levels.
population_specificity: Korean patients with stage 3-4 CKD.
effective_dosage: Home-delivered meals twice daily, 5 days a week.
study_duration: 4 weeks per intervention (with a 4-week washout period in between).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of the Mediterranean Diet (MedDiet) in preventing and managing Metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD) in Western populations and explore the potential benefits of combining it with physical activity.
results_summary: The study found that the MedDiet is effective for preventing and managing MASLD, though most supporting evidence comes from Mediterranean countries. The combination of MedDiet with physical activity remains understudied, and digital health platforms could improve intervention accessibility.
population_specificity: Western, multicultural populations with MASLD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of the Wellness@Work for UniTo Project in improving adherence to the Mediterranean Diet and health outcomes among university employees.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in anthropometric, body composition, and Mediterranean Diet adherence variables after a 4-month intervention, suggesting the program effectively enhanced workers' health.
population_specificity: University employees (479 workers, with 246 completing follow-up assessments).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the association of adherence to the Mediterranean Diet with arterial stiffness, inflammation, and disease-related medication use in women with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
results_summary: The study found no overall association between adherence to the Mediterranean Diet and arterial stiffness, inflammation, or medication use. However, lower intake of full dairy products was linked to higher corticosteroid use, and lower red wine consumption was associated with lower immunosuppressant use.
population_specificity: 76 women with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between the Mediterranean Diet and breast cancer outcomes, focusing on its potential benefits in prevention, management, and survival rates.
results_summary: Adherence to the Mediterranean Diet correlated with improved quality of life, reduced mortality rates in breast cancer patients, and demonstrated anti-cancer properties through antioxidant and anti-inflammatory effects. Specific unsaturated fats and dietary components like olive oil polyphenols were highlighted for their protective roles.
population_specificity: Women with breast cancer, particularly older age groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of a Mediterranean diet, alone and combined with respiratory muscle training, on emotional intelligence, ventilatory fatigue, and stress in woodwind musicians.
results_summary: The Mediterranean diet improved emotional intelligence (attention, clarity, repair) and ventilatory measures (FEV1, FVC) significantly, though it had no significant impact on physiological stress. Combining the diet with respiratory training further enhanced these benefits.
population_specificity: 70 woodwind musicians from the Valencia Conservatory of Music.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review meta-analyses of randomized controlled trials evaluating the effectiveness of the Mediterranean Diet for primary and secondary prevention of cardiovascular disease.
results_summary: The Mediterranean Diet was associated with reduced cardiovascular disease mortality (10%-67% reduction) and non-fatal myocardial infarctions (21%-70% reduction), particularly in populations with established cardiovascular disease, though the methodological quality of most reviews was low or critically low.
population_specificity: Adults ≥18 years from the general population with or without established cardiovascular disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between oral health-related quality of life and adherence to the Mediterranean diet in a disadvantaged Mexican population.
results_summary: The study found a notable presence of caries in individuals with low adherence to the Mediterranean diet, suggesting a potential interaction between diet, oral health, and obesity. The mean Oral Health-Related Quality of Life score was 13.19 ±13.57.
population_specificity: 109 individuals aged 4-72 years in Merida, Yucatan, Mexico.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of a Mediterranean diet versus Irish Healthy Eating Guidelines on physical function and quality of life in adults with rheumatoid arthritis.
results_summary: The Mediterranean diet group showed significantly better improvements in physical function and quality of life compared to the Irish Healthy Eating Guidelines group. Both diets led to significant improvements in physical function and quality of life, but physical activity improved only in the Mediterranean diet group.
population_specificity: Adults with rheumatoid arthritis in Ireland (primarily females, mean age 47.5 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of a 6-day Mediterranean diet intervention on plasma metabolites and the healthy dietary metabolic signature (HDMS).
results_summary: The Mediterranean diet intervention significantly improved the HDMS, with 66 out of 109 metabolites showing significant changes, including increases in markers linked to vegetable, fruit, grain, and legume intake and decreases in markers associated with red meat consumption.
population_specificity: 59 Swedish participants (71% women, mean age 69 years).
effective_dosage: Not specified (all meals provided, crafted from local recipes and ingredients).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether adherence to the Mediterranean diet reduces the incidence of colorectal cancer (CRC) based on pooled evidence from clinical trials and case-control studies.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that adherence to the Mediterranean diet significantly reduced CRC prevalence (HR = 0.84, 95% CI = 0.78-0.91, p < 0.01), with consistent protective effects across sexes and a particularly strong effect in case-control studies (HR = 0.51, 95% CI = 0.38-0.68, p < 0.01).
population_specificity: The study included a pooled sample of 2,217,404 subjects from clinical trials and case-control studies, with specific relevance to the Hungarian population.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between adherence to the Mediterranean Diet (MD) and disease activity, as well as quality of life, in patients with Crohn's disease (CD).
results_summary: Adherence to the MD was significantly higher in patients with inactive CD and negatively correlated with disease activity while positively correlated with quality of life. Higher intake of fruits, vegetables, and dairy products was observed in remission patients.
population_specificity: Male and female patients with Crohn's disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of Mediterranean diet and exercise on the presentation and severity of psoriatic arthritis (PsA) and psoriasis (PsO).
results_summary: Higher adherence to the Mediterranean diet was associated with reduced disease activity markers (ESR, PASI, BSA) in PsA patients. Exercise also showed an inverse correlation with disease activity indices, independent of BMI.
population_specificity: 355 patients with psoriatic arthritis (n=279) and psoriasis (n=76).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to confirm the effectiveness of a teaching pack in improving adherence to the Mediterranean Diet among children, with follow-up data collected a year after the baseline intervention.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in adherence to the Mediterranean Diet, with high adherence rates increasing from 24.4% to 43.3% and low adherence rates decreasing from 15.0% to 3.9%. These improvements were observed across sexes, geographical areas, and weight status classes.
population_specificity: 494 fourth-class children (8-10 years old) from 13 schools in three areas with varying prevalence of overweight/obesity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of personalized dietary management, standardized dietary recommendations, and usual care control on glycemic control in individuals with type 2 diabetes using a Mediterranean diet framework.
results_summary: The study evaluates the impact of personalized and standardized dietary interventions on glycemic excursions (MAGE) in type 2 diabetes patients, with results pending as the abstract describes the study design rather than outcomes.
population_specificity: Adults aged 21-80 with moderately controlled type 2 diabetes (HbA1c: 6.0 to 8.0%) managed on lifestyle alone or lifestyle plus metformin.
effective_dosage: Isocaloric energy and macronutrient targets aligned with Mediterranean diet guidelines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of including ultra-processed foods (UPF) within a Mediterranean-based dietary pattern on cardiometabolic markers, gut microbiota, and other health and environmental indicators.
results_summary: The study is ongoing, so no results are reported in the abstract. The primary endpoint will assess changes in plasma LDL-cholesterol levels, with additional markers including blood pressure, metabolic parameters, microbiota composition, and food waste production.
population_specificity: Fifty clinically healthy individuals with overweight and low-to-moderate cardiovascular risk.
effective_dosage: 5 servings/day of selected UPF items (intervention group) vs. raw/minimally processed items (control group).
study_duration: 3 months per intervention group, with a 1-month wash-out period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of Mediterranean Diet-based interventions on biomarkers of cardiometabolic health in children and adolescents.
results_summary: The study found that Mediterranean Diet-based interventions significantly reduced systolic blood pressure, triglycerides, total cholesterol, and LDL-C while increasing HDL-C, but showed no significant effects on diastolic blood pressure, glucose, insulin, or HOMA-IR.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents aged ≤18 years (mean age: 11 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the feasibility of Compassion Cultivation Training (CCT) in reducing psychological distress and improving well-being in medical students.
results_summary: CCT significantly improved self-compassion, mindfulness, and emotion regulation while reducing stress, anxiety, and emotional exhaustion; some effects persisted at follow-up. No adverse effects were reported.
population_specificity: Medical students

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize evidence on the impact of interventions, including mindfulness, on well-being and burnout in healthcare workers.
results_summary: Mindfulness-based practices were effective in improving well-being, work engagement, quality of life, and resilience, while reducing burnout, perceived stress, anxiety, and depression in healthcare workers.
population_specificity: Physicians, nurses, and allied healthcare professionals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness of pain-focused psychological interventions, including mindfulness therapy, in alleviating pain among women with endometriosis.
results_summary: The study found that mindfulness therapy, along with other psychological interventions, improved and reduced pain in women with endometriosis. Four studies specifically focused on mindfulness therapy, showing positive outcomes.
population_specificity: Women with endometriosis (EMS) experiencing pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether adding mindfulness to neuromuscular exercises improved pain, function, balance, and quality of life in patients with knee osteoarthritis.
results_summary: The study found that adding mindfulness to neuromuscular exercises reduced pain intensity and improved function, balance, and quality of life in adults with knee osteoarthritis, though motivational interviewing showed greater effectiveness.
population_specificity: Adults with knee osteoarthritis (60 patients).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of mindfulness-based therapies (MBCT, ACT, MBSR) in treating episodic migraine and related psychiatric comorbidities.
results_summary: Mindfulness-based therapies showed promising results for patients with episodic migraine and comorbid psychiatric conditions, potentially improving treatment efficacy and patient-centered care. The study suggests these interventions may enhance self-efficacy and reduce migraine frequency alongside psychiatric symptoms.
population_specificity: Patients diagnosed with episodic migraine and comorbid psychiatric conditions (depression, anxiety, PTSD, sleep disorders).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility and acceptability of a mindfulness intervention tailored for midlife and older women with low libido and evaluate its impact on sexual function and distress.
results_summary: The mindfulness intervention was feasible and acceptable, with high satisfaction rates (73%) and significant improvements in sexual distress (P = .021), though no significant changes in sexual function were observed. Women in the mindfulness group were more likely to recommend the intervention compared to the education control group (P = .031).
population_specificity: Women aged ≥45 years with low libido.
study_duration: 6 weeks post-intervention follow-up (exact intervention duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of Mindfulness-Based Relapse Prevention (MBRP) in reducing relapse among veterans following completion of a substance use disorder (SUD) treatment program, compared to 12-step facilitation (TSF).
results_summary: Both MBRP and TSF groups maintained reductions in alcohol and illicit substance use during aftercare, with no significant differences in relapse rates between the two interventions. Retention in treatment was a limiting factor, but both approaches were effective in sustaining treatment gains.
population_specificity: Military veterans who completed intensive treatment for substance use disorders.
study_duration: 8 weeks, with follow-ups at 3, 6, and 10 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and distinctiveness of Acceptance and Commitment Therapy for psychosis (ACTp) compared to other cognitive behavioral and mindfulness-based interventions, as well as identify optimal implementation conditions.
results_summary: ACTp shows promise as a pragmatic, process-driven intervention with meaningful effects on outcomes like rehospitalization, depression, and psychotic symptom distress. Further research is needed to refine the model and explore lower-intensity or technology-assisted delivery methods.
population_specificity: Individuals with psychosis

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess how mindfulness and worry, as emotion regulation strategies, corresponded to changes in focus problems, memory problems, fatigue, and pain sensitivity among breast cancer survivors.
results_summary: Breast cancer survivors with lower mindfulness experienced higher subjective fatigue, memory problems, focus difficulties, and pain sensitivity. However, mindfulness did not predict objective pain sensitivity or cognitive problems.
population_specificity: Breast cancer survivors (N = 149)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a multimodal lifestyle intervention, including mindfulness, in reducing dementia risk in healthy older adults.
results_summary: The study protocol outlines a 12-week intervention integrating mindfulness with exercise, diet, and sleep, but specific results regarding mindfulness's effects are not yet reported as the abstract describes the trial design rather than outcomes.
population_specificity: Healthy older adults aged 50-85 years in the Sunshine Coast region of Australia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine psycho-oncologists' awareness and self-efficacy regarding mindfulness-based interventions for cancer-related fatigue and identify gaps in professional training.
results_summary: The study found that 82% of psycho-oncologists were aware of the empirical evidence supporting mindfulness-based interventions for fatigue, indicating its perceived efficacy, though specific effectiveness data were not detailed.
population_specificity: Psycho-oncologists working in Germany.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of an online Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) programme on prenatal comfort and foetal anxiety levels in pregnant women.
results_summary: The MBSR programme significantly increased prenatal comfort levels and decreased foetal health anxieties in pregnant women, with statistically significant differences between the experimental and control groups.
population_specificity: Pregnant women registered in a Family Health Centre in Adiyaman, Turkey.
effective_dosage: Eight sessions, one session per week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the acceptability, feasibility, and preliminary efficacy of a digital mindfulness-based intervention (Mindful Courage-Beta) for individuals with anorexia nervosa (AN) or atypical AN.
results_summary: The intervention showed good acceptability and adherence, with high use of mindfulness skills (BOAT) in daily life, which was associated with increased state mindfulness. Significant improvements were observed in trait mindfulness, emotion regulation, eating disorder symptoms, and body dissatisfaction.
population_specificity: Individuals with past-year AN or atypical AN (n=18).
effective_dosage: One foundational multimedia module and 10 daily meditation mini-modules.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare mindfulness against sham conditions to determine whether improvements in chronic pain were due to mindfulness-specific effects or placebo effects.
results_summary: Mindfulness was not superior to sham conditions for reducing pain intensity or unpleasantness, and no differential engagement of mindfulness-specific processes was observed. However, mindfulness and both shams reduced pain unpleasantness relative to the audiobook control, with expectancy being the strongest factor associated with this effect.
population_specificity: 169 adults with chronic or recurrent pain

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Mindfulness-Oriented Recovery Enhancement (MORE) could effectively treat anhedonia and reward deficits in chronic pain patients receiving long-term opioid therapy (LTOT).
results_summary: Patients treated with MORE showed significantly increased neural and physiological responses to natural reward cues and greater reductions in subjective anhedonia compared to the control group. The improvement in anhedonia was mediated by enhanced electrocortical activity during savoring.
population_specificity: Veterans receiving long-term opioid therapy for chronic pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether posthospital discharge support, including mindfulness, could reduce readmissions and associated costs in cardiovascular patients by addressing behavioral and psychosocial factors.
results_summary: The intervention group, which included mindfulness among other supports, showed significantly lower readmission costs ($1.1 million vs. $2.0 million) and mean cost per readmitted patient ($44,052 vs. $91,278) compared to the control group. Adjusted mean expected readmission costs were also lower in the intervention group ($8,094 vs. $9,882, p = .011).
population_specificity: Adult patients admitted to the hospital with a cardiovascular diagnosis and a plan to discharge home.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of a brief interpersonal mindfulness program embedded in a psychiatric nursing practicum on stress reduction and mindfulness in nursing students.
results_summary: The experimental group showed statistically significant improvements in mindfulness subscales (Observing, Describing, Non-reacting) and overall mindfulness scores compared to the control group, with large effect sizes. Qualitative findings highlighted initial challenges, increased mindfulness, intrapersonal benefits, and improved interpersonal skills.
population_specificity: Fourth-year nursing students in Thailand.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a psychoeducational group program focused on resilience, insight, self-compassion, and empowerment could improve mental well-being and reduce burnout among nurse leaders.
results_summary: The intervention group showed significant improvements in post-traumatic growth, self-reflection, self-compassion, psychological empowerment, and compassion satisfaction, along with reductions in perceived stress, burnout, and secondary traumatic stress compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Unit-based nurse leaders (nurse managers and assistant nurse managers).
study_duration: Follow-up assessments were conducted at endpoint, one-month, three-month, and six-month intervals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an integrative model to understand how mindfulness, acceptance, self-efficacy, uncertainty, meaning, and purpose in life influence the self-perception of well-being in individuals with cancer.
results_summary: The study proposed an integrative model showing that mindfulness, acceptance, self-efficacy, and uncertainty can predict well-being in cancer patients, with meaning and purpose in life acting as mediators or moderators. The model supports the use of mindfulness-based approaches, Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT), and Meaning-Centered Psychotherapy (MCP) in clinical oncology.
population_specificity: Individuals with cancer

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of a group-based, brief transdiagnostic CBT program, which included mindfulness, for reducing anxiety and depressive symptoms in adolescents with internalizing problems.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in self-reported anxiety and depression scores among adolescents receiving the CBT program, which included mindfulness. Parent-reported scores showed improvement during naturalistic follow-up, though not during active treatment.
population_specificity: Adolescents with internalizing problems (anxiety and depressive disorders) seeking help in a primary health care clinic in Iceland.
effective_dosage: Eight weekly 110-minute sessions (mindfulness was one component among others).
study_duration: 8 weeks (with follow-ups at 2, 4 months, and 1 year).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of mindfulness-based sexual counseling (MBSC) on sexual distress, attitudes toward sexuality, and body image concerns in pregnant women.
results_summary: MBSC significantly reduced sexual distress and body image concerns while improving attitudes toward sexuality in pregnant women compared to the control group. The results were statistically significant (P < .001 for sexual distress and body image concerns, P < .05 for attitudes toward sexuality).
population_specificity: Pregnant women experiencing sexual distress in eastern Turkey.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the impact of mindfulness meditation (MM) on substance use among Veterans with chronic pain, comparing it to hypnosis and an active education control.
results_summary: MM significantly reduced the risk of daily cannabis use by 85% at 3 months and 81% at 6 months post-treatment compared to the control group. No significant effects were observed for tobacco or alcohol use.
population_specificity: 328 Veterans with chronic pain receiving care at two Veterans Affairs Medical Centers in the northwest United States.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the feasibility and initial impact of two brief emotion regulation skill trainings targeting trauma-related problems compared to an active control.
results_summary: The study found that all three internet-delivered trainings were feasible and acceptable, with participants showing significant decreases in emotion regulation problems over time, though improvements did not differ by condition. Participants with higher PTSD symptoms in the Change condition had greater increases in positive affect compared to those with lower symptoms.
population_specificity: Individuals with trauma-related distress, including subthreshold PTSD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize fMRI findings on how mindfulness-based interventions (MBIs) affect brain function in individuals with substance use disorders (SUDs) and their associations with mindfulness, craving, and drug use.
results_summary: MBIs in SUDs were associated with functional changes in brain pathways linked to mindfulness and addiction (e.g., anterior cingulate cortex and striatum), correlating with increased mindfulness, reduced craving, and lower drug use. However, the evidence remains limited, and more fMRI studies are needed.
population_specificity: Individuals with substance use disorders (6 tobacco, 1 opioid).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the current understanding and evidence for mindfulness meditation in managing acute pain and its potential integration into acute pain service practice.
results_summary: The study found conflicting evidence on meditation's effectiveness for acute pain, with some studies highlighting its impact on emotional response rather than pain intensity reduction. Functional MRI identified brain areas involved in meditation-induced pain relief, suggesting potential benefits through neurocognitive changes.
population_specificity: Not specified (general acute pain context)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine relapse prediction and prevention strategies, including mindfulness, for individuals with substance use disorder (SUD), particularly recovering anesthesia providers.
results_summary: The study identified mindfulness as one of several strategies for relapse prevention in SUD, alongside other approaches like neuroimaging and biological monitoring. However, the abstract does not provide specific details on mindfulness's effectiveness compared to other methods.
population_specificity: Individuals with substance use disorder, with a focus on recovering anesthesia providers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of mindfulness as an early intervention for hazardous alcohol use among Latine emerging adults and identify future research directions for culturally tailored mindfulness-based interventions (MBIs).
results_summary: The review suggests mindfulness can interrupt habituated cognitions and automatic behaviors linked to hazardous drinking but highlights the lack of Latine representation in MBI trials. It proposes pairing MBI with contingency management to reduce attrition in future trials.
population_specificity: Latine emerging adults (ages 18-29) in the U.S.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize interventions, including mindfulness-based approaches, designed to enhance resilience in family caregivers.
results_summary: The review found emerging evidence that mindfulness-based interventions may improve caregiver resilience, though the most effective intervention and dosage remain unclear due to limited studies and moderate study quality.
population_specificity: Family caregivers (FCs)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of mindfulness-based interventions (MBIs) on psychological and physical rehabilitation outcomes in individuals poststroke.
results_summary: The study found mixed results, with significant improvements in mental fatigue, cognition, and quality of life in most studies, while outcomes for mood and physical functioning were inconsistent. The evidence supports MBIs as potentially beneficial but highlights the need for more rigorous research.
population_specificity: Individuals poststroke

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if mindfulness-based interventions (MBIs) could be useful as a component of cognitive-behavioral therapy for insomnia (CBT-I) by analyzing their effects on insomnia severity and sleep quality.
results_summary: MBIs showed a small to medium effect on insomnia severity (nearing significance), a non-significant medium effect on sleep quality, and a small but significant effect on a composite sleep variable. The analysis could not conclusively demonstrate that MBIs positively affected insomnia in the general adult population.
population_specificity: Adults with chronic insomnia disorder (ID).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of online mindfulness therapy (MT) versus traditional counseling therapy (CT) in aiding smoking cessation and improving mental health among an Asian population.
results_summary: The MT group showed a statistically significant reduction in cigarette consumption and significant improvements in mental health metrics (AAQ-2, anxiety, stress, depression, and mindfulness) compared to the CT group.
population_specificity: Asian smokers participating in a smoking cessation program.
effective_dosage: Three sessions of online therapy (MT or CT), once every two weeks, plus one weekly phone call as reinforcement.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify effective web- and app-based interventions, including mindfulness techniques, for reducing job-related stress and stress-related symptoms.
results_summary: The review identified 19 effective mHealth products, all of which improved mental and/or physical health and reduced stress, using methods such as mindfulness, cognitive restructuring, and emotional regulation. Most products had a course-like structure lasting 1-8 weeks and employed mixed materials like text, videos, and audio.
population_specificity: Employees experiencing job-related stress.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of mindfulness-based interventions as a nonhormonal treatment for menopause-associated vasomotor symptoms.
